words2022.definition: relating to vestibule, particularly that of the inner ear, or more generally to the sense of balance.
words2022.usage: the vestibular system

words2022.definition: (1) enabling someone to discover or learn something for themselves. (2) mental shortcut that allows people to solve problems and make judgments quickly and efficiently,
words2022.usage: a heuristic process or method.

words2022.definition: short-sightedness either physically or intellectually.
words2022.usage: It can lead to myopia.

words2022.definition: a sever flood or heavy rain fall.
words2022.usage: They who pray for dew at the desert's edge shall bring forth the deluge!

words2022.definition: give a deep roar of pain or anger, shout loudly.
words2022.usage: He bellowed in agony. A bellow of rage.

words2022.definition: loud and powerful. Origin is Stentor meaning a herald in the Trojan War.
words2022.usage: The Preacher raised his arms, lifted his voice in a stentorian bellow.

words2022.definition: having or showing shrewdness and good judgement, especially in money or business matters.
words2022.usage: Canny investors will switch banks if they think they are getting a raw deal.

words2022.definition: strange or mysterious, especially in an unsettling way.
words2022.usage: an uncanny feeling that she was being watched.

words2022.definition: (1) a person who takes responsibility for another's performance of an undertaking, for example their appearing in court or paying a debt. (2) the state of being sure or certain of something.
words2022.usage: the rights of wives who act as sureties for their husband's debts

words2022.definition: A type of government marked by excessive bureaucracy and Byzantine regulations. Political form of rule by mandarins.
words2022.usage: It will strengthen their mandarinate and help them to endure in a universe which finds them increasingly oppressive.

words2022.definition: the quality of being convenient and practical despite possibly being improper or immoral; convenience.
words2022.usage: short-term expediency always fails in the long term.

words2022.definition: insolent or disrespectful behaviour
words2022.usage: one juror had the effrontery to challenge the coroner's decision.

words2022.definition: the quality of being sagacious (wise, having good judgement), wisdom
words2022.usage: a man of great political sagacity

words2022.definition: Deceit, disloyalty. perfidious is the adjective.
words2022.usage: It was an example of his perfidy.

words2022.definition: vague, being able to see the future (having supernatural powers of clairvoyance).
words2022.usage: a rather fey romantic novelist

words2022.definition: an assistant or follower.
words2022.usage: She runs the department through a small group of acolytes.

words2022.definition: relating or reverting to the earliest human.
words2022.usage: atavistic fear

words2022.definition: wrath beneath a shallow veneer. Attractive appearance that disguises one's true feelings. A thin decorative cover on the wood. Timber veneer is a real timber, sliced very finely and then glued to a substrate to make it look like a real timber.
words2022.usage: wrath beneath a shallow veneer.

words2022.definition: 1. a vessel in which metals or other substances are headed to a very high temperature. 2. a severe test 3. a place or situation in which concentrated forces interact to cause or influence change or development.
words2022.usage: It was my crucible.

words2022.definition: A ruler with total power, especially one who uses it in a cruel way.
words2022.usage: How do you make despotism lovable? You are not a despot.

words2022.definition: hot-tempered, irritable
words2022.usage: Life changed those irascible wastes into shapes of grace and movement. Irascible and difficult man.

words2022.definition: (1) very careful about the accuracy and details. (2) very concerned about cleanliness.
words2022.usage: there might be a certain fastidious courtesy in dying without a trace.

words2022.definition: a person who interferes in someone else's affairs.
words2022.usage: Yet he was an interloper here.

words2022.definition: (1) chop or cut with an axe, pick or other tools. (2) make or shape by cutting or chopping a material such as wood or stone.
words2022.usage: A seat hewn out of a fallen tree trunk.

words2022.definition: Regard with great respect. Revere. adj. venerable.
words2022.usage: He was venerated as a saint.

words2022.definition: Deceit used in order to achieve one's goal.
words2022.usage: He had to use subterfuge and bluff on many occasions.

words2022.definition: (1) relating to a tomb or interment, (2) gloomy, dismal
words2022.usage: sepulchral monuments, a speech delivered in sepulchral tones. Sepulchre is a noun meaning tomb.

words2022.definition: (1) holding or constituting a purely formal position or title without authority. (2) relating to or denoted by a title.
words2022.usage: The queen is titular head of the Church of England.

words2022.definition: authoritative prohibition, intercept and prevent the movement of something.
words2022.usage: Society will never interdict sex.

words2022.definition: leadership or dominance, especially by one state or social group over others.
words2022.usage: political hegemony

words2022.definition: hazy
words2022.usage: nebulous future

words2022.definition: showing great care and perseverance
words2022.usage: The foundation has fostered this delusion assiduously

words2022.definition: doubtful authenticity
words2022.usage: Apocryphal tale

words2022.definition: a state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts; a daydream.
words2022.usage: eyes drifted into a reverie

words2022.definition: hostile and aggressive.
words2022.usage: the mood at the meeting was belligerent

words2022.definition: a thing that is very old or old-fashioned, especially an archaic word or style of language or art.
words2022.usage: conscious archaisms inspired by French harpsichord music

words2022.definition: a right or privilege exclusive to a particular individual or class.
words2022.usage: in some countries, higher education is predominantly the prerogative of the rich

words2022.definition: a trite statement that is intended to soothe or placate
words2022.usage: feel-good bromides create the illusion of problem-solving

words2022.definition: To improve people's minds or characters by teaching them something.
words2022.usage: edifying literature.

words2022.definition: Showing strong feelings, especially anger.
words2022.usage: her voice was low but vehement.

words2022.definition: To say unfairly that sb is responsible for sth.
words2022.usage: my employer was imputing to me.

words2022.definition: gloomy, relentlessly severe, stern
words2022.usage: Elated or dour?

words2022.definition: eager, quick to argue or fight
words2022.usage: Funny or truculent?

words2022.definition: the pit of the stomach
words2022.usage: punch at my solar plexus

words2022.definition: an arrangement of a body of troops with its units each somewhat to the left or right of the one in the rear like a series of steps
words2022.usage: geese flying in echelon

words2022.definition: warm, tropical
words2022.usage: balmy weather

words2022.definition: having a sloping edge rather than a squared one.
words2022.usage: a bevelled mirror

words2022.definition: any of numerous small slender long-tailed parrots
words2022.usage: a flock of paraquet

words2022.definition: a heavy handwoven reversible textile used for hangings, curtains, and upholstery and characterized by complicated pictorial designs.
words2022.usage: the rococo tapestries

words2022.definition: pale, insipid
words2022.usage: his face, with its wrinkled, pallid complexion.

words2022.definition: (1) uncalled for, (2) done free of charge
words2022.usage: (1) gratuitous violence, (2) gratuitous legal advice

words2022.definition: moody, unpredictable
words2022.usage: a capricious climate

words2022.definition: not able to be changed or reformed.
words2022.usage: James, you're incorrigible

words2022.definition: an outcast
words2022.usage: They were treated as social pariahs.

words2022.definition: (1) make an unpleasant feeling less intense. (2) satisfy
words2022.usage: pray assauges hunger

words2022.definition: a stately or impressive building hosing a tomb or group of tombs.
words2022.usage: The cathedral was built in 1517 as a royal mausoleum.

words2022.definition: not claiming attention for oneself; retiring and modest.
words2022.usage: His demeanour was self-effacing, gracious, and polite.

words2022.definition: A journey, especially a long or meandering one.
words2022.usage: She kept Aunt Lisa company on her peregrinations.

words2022.definition: (1) A soft gentle breeze, (2) The god of the West Wind (in Bible).
words2022.usage: Zephyr in the sky at night I wonder

words2022.definition: A bod of troops or police officers standing or moving in close formation.
words2022.usage: Six hundred marchers set off, led by a phalanx of police.

words2022.definition: negligent
words2022.usage: It would be remiss of me not to pass on that information. I have been remiss.

words2022.definition: grant
words2022.usage: You conferred overlong with their new ambassadors.

words2022.definition: Very unwilling to spend money or use resources.
words2022.usage: Even the parsimonious Joe paid for drinks all round.

words2022.definition: pretentious or juvenile
words2022.usage: Your question is sophomoric.

words2022.definition: a fine or petty point of conduct or procedure.
words2022.usage: Your masters are a curious mix of punctilio and laxity.

words2022.definition: (1) lack of strictness or care. (2) looseness of a limb or muscle.
words2022.usage: Your masters are a curious mix of punctilio and laxity.

words2022.definition: charm or enchant (someone), often in a deceptive way.
words2022.usage: They intended me to beguile him.

words2022.definition: the state of being close to someone or something; proximity.
words2022.usage: Let propinquity take its usual course.

words2022.definition: a firm warning or reprimand.
words2022.usage: I have deliberately ignored the admonition of Mohammed and Moses.

words2022.definition: a being responsible for the creation of the universe. In Platonic philosophy, the Maker or Creator of the world.
words2022.usage: He was something else, a demiurge who stood next to God.

words2022.definition: fortune teller
words2022.usage: A soothsayer warns Caesar to Beware the ides of March.

words2022.definition: the 15th of day of the month
words2022.usage: Beware the ides of March.

words2022.definition: as appears or is stated to be true, though not necessarily so, different from apparently slightly
words2022.usage: The party secretary resigned, ostensibly from ill health

words2022.definition: large amount
words2022.usage: Many a little makes a mickle

words2022.definition: unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
words2022.usage: The purchaser should avoid asking for superfluous information.

words2022.definition: a beast from the biblical Book of Job, chaos-monster created by God. also used to describe a big business entity.
words2022.usage: Shoppers are now more loyal to their local shops than to faceless behemoths.

words2022.definition: A form of schizophrenia in which a person experiences periods of unconsciousness or overactivity.
words2022.usage: Idaho drew back from catatonic forgetfulness.

words2022.definition: (1) a foundation or basis of something, (2) an underlying layer or substance, in particular a layer of rock or soil beneath the surface of the ground.
words2022.usage: There is a broad substratum of truth in her theory. The plant will grow very rapidly and send out runners above the substratum.

words2022.definition: pleasure derived by someone from another person's misfortune.
words2022.usage: A business that thrives on schadenfreude.

words2022.definition: a large tank or tub to hold liquid, especially in industry
words2022.usage: a vat of hot tar

words2022.usage: to be filled

words2022.usage: to be filled
